clinical_study.brief_title: Survey on Itch in Outpatients of a University Clinic
clinical_study.official_title: Survey on Itch in Outpatients of a University Clinic

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to investigate the pruriception (i.e. the perception of the character and intensity of itch), the impact of itch on quality of life, the response to itch and the subjective efficacy and preferences of the different treatment options among patients with different skin diseases. Better insights into these aspects might help to optimize itch treatment in clinical Settings.

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questions regarding itch perception (NRS 0-10; 0 = no itch, 10 = worst imaginable itch) experienced at the moment, within the last 7 days, within the last month

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questions regarding situations in which the itch is especially bad (multiple choice options regarding day time, daily situations, season); objective assessment in which respondents are asked to select answers from the choices offered as a list

primary_outcome.measure: impact of itch on quality of life
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questions regarding strength of impact of itch on quality of life (NRS 0-10; 0 = no impact, 10 = extreme)

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questions regarding sleep disturbance by itch (Does itch disturb the patient's sleep and/or sleep of other persons? (yes/no))

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Approximate number of days missing at work due to itch within last 6 months

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questions regarding helpfulness of common itch therapies (NRS 0-10; 0 = no reduction in itch, 10 = complete reduction of itch; additionally free text options to indicate specific creams, tablets or alternative medicine)

primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questions regarding preferred treatment options (NRS 0- 10; 0 = unimportant, 10 = most important; including additional free text option)

intervention.description: self-administered patient questionnaire regarding the different aspects of itch

study_pop.textblock: All outpatients of the dermatologic university clinic suffering from itch are eligible to participate in the study (from December 2015 until the end of April 2016).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- outpatients suffering from itch
Exclusion Criteria:
- outpatients (suffering from itch) not willing or able to participate
